paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variants, specifically the V30M mutation and the SNP rs62093482-C>T, focusing on their penetrance and expression in Swedish ATTR patients.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No difference in allele specific expression between the allele containing the V30M mutation and the wild type allele was observed.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: However, in the heterozygous samples no difference in allele specific expression between the allele containing the V30M mutation and the rs62093482-T compared to the wild type allele was observed either.

functional_data.summary: No significant difference in expression between the two alleles was noted.

variants.additional_notes: The SNP rs62093482-T was found to have no effect on the expression of the TTR gene.
key_quotes: The SNP found in the 3′ UTR of the TTR gene has no effect on degrading the variant allele’s expression and thus has no impact on the diminished penetrance of the trait in the Swedish population.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No difference in allele specific expression between the allele containing the V30M mutation and the wild type allele was observed.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: However, in the heterozygous samples no difference in allele specific expression between the allele containing the V30M mutation and the rs62093482-T compared to the wild type allele was observed either.

functional_data.summary: The SNP does not affect the expression of the TTR gene.

variants.additional_notes: The SNP is unique for patients descending from the Swedish founder.
key_quotes: This SNP could be utilized to identify ATTR patients of Swedish descent.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants were extracted from the main text.
